content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
• Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
  Consists of:
  – Stone Furnace at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) outfitted with burner‑inserters, linked transport belts, and wooden chests.
  – Stone Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) configured similarly.
  (This structure continues operating without changes.)

• Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
  Consists of:
  – Burner‑Mining Drill at Position(x=-15.0, y=-50.0) channeling ore into a Wooden Chest at Position(x=-13.5, y=-51.5) via dedicated transport belts.
  (No modifications have been observed.)

• Steam Power Generation System  
  Consists of:
  – Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) dedicated to steam production.
  – Steam Engines deployed at multiple positions:  
  • Position(x=0.5, y=9.5)  
  • Position(x=18.5, y=11.5)  
  • Position(x=1.5, y=13.5)  
  • Position(x=13.5, y=14.5)  
  • Position(x=19.5, y=14.5)  
  • Position(x=22.5, y=18.5)  
  • Position(x=17.5, y=20.5)  
  • Position(x=12.5, y=21.5)  
  • Position(x=4.5, y=23.5)
  – An extra steam engine was intended for a clear buildable area near approximately Position(x=8.5, y=22.5). However, persistent congestion—marked by overlapping and misaligned connection elements in the boiler vicinity—has prevented its placement.
  (The core system remains partially effective despite this unresolved issue.)

• Automation Research Lab  
  Consists of:
  – A Lab unit configured to process automation‑science‑pack inputs.
  (The lab remains unpowered and awaits integration into the electrical network.)

• Electrical and Transport Infrastructure  
  Consists of:
  – Interconnected Electricity Groups linking poles across the network.
  – Belt Groups and Pipe Groups providing material and fluid transfer.
  (These networks continue to support operations without notable updates.)

ERROR TIPS
─────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement  
  – Issue: The extra steam engine repeatedly fails to be placed due to severe congestion. The boiler at Position(8.0, 20.5) is crowded with misaligned burner‑inserters and overlapping transport belts, which completely obstruct the designated clearance near approximately Position(8.5, 22.5).
  – Recommendation: Perform a thorough manual inspection of the boiler area and all adjacent connection interfaces. Remove or reposition interfering entities to clear the buildable space, or consider relocating the extra engine to a less congested zone.

• Fuel Supply Management  
  – Issue: Numerous burner‑inserters and mining drills are reporting “out of fuel” warnings.
  – Recommendation: Establish a regular refueling routine and closely monitor fuel inventories (e.g., coal) to ensure uninterrupted operation.

• Connection and Fluid Input for Steam Engines  
  – Issue: Multiple steam engines present warnings such as “not connected to power network,” “no input liquid,” and “no fluid present in connections.”
  – Recommendation: Verify that each steam engine’s electrical and fluid connection points are properly aligned with the boiler and the pipe network. Recheck the configuration of power and fluid systems to secure proper delivery.

• Lab Power Deficiency  
  – Issue: The Automation Research Lab remains without power.
  – Recommendation: Reassess the lab’s integration with the main electrical network and connect it appropriately to supply the necessary energy.

(No custom utility functions have been defined by the agent.)
